page.title: 06Michael Syddall C.E.School
page.content: {Michael Syddall School}is a Voluntary Aided Church of England Primary School.The present building is light and airy and was opened on the 18th June 1974 by the Bishop of Ripon. Although the present building is modern,the school has an old foundation.{The Rev.Michael Syddall, who was Vicar of Catterick from 1649 to 1658 bequeathed the sum of Â£500 for the establishment of a school and also to provide accommodation for six local widows.The school was founded in 1658. At present the school has just over 200 pupils aged between 5 and 11 years.The children come from Tunstall, R.A.F.Catterick,East Appleton and Catterick Village.The children leave at the age of 11 years,when they move to secondary schools.
